archimate:Capability.name: Physical and Environmental Management
archimate:Capability.documentation:
This capability entails protecting critical facilities and services against a range of threats, guided by a specialized physical risk assessment. The protection is aimed at safeguarding against targeted cyber attacks, unauthorized physical access, accidental damage, loss of power, fire, and other environmental or natural hazards. By conducting a thorough physical risk assessment, the organization can identify specific vulnerabilities and implement appropriate protective measures for its critical facilities and services.
Additionally, the capability involves the physical protection of all environments against unauthorized physical access. This includes securing various locations and assets within the organization to prevent unauthorized entry or access, thereby safeguarding sensitive information and critical infrastructure.
Furthermore, the capability includes appointing local security coordinators in business units or departments throughout the organization. These coordinators are responsible for several key functions: maintaining a security profile that contains important details about business users, information, business applications, equipment, technology, and locations; promoting information security within their respective areas; and managing information risk. The role of local security coordinators is crucial in ensuring that security practices are effectively implemented and maintained at the departmental level, contributing to the overall security posture of the organization.
